item.title: Welcome to the New Galatean Saga Website
item.description:
A New Home for The Galatean Saga

I’m excited to announce the launch of the new official website for The Galatean Saga! After years on Blogger, I’ve moved to a more flexible platform that better reflects the immersive, multi-dimensional nature of this universe.

Why the Change?

The old Blogger site served us well, but as The Galatean Saga has grown from a single book concept into a multimedia storytelling experiment—spanning novels, music, video, and interactive experiences—I needed a space that could evolve with it.

item.title: Behind the Scenes: The Spacer and the December Chronicles
item.description:
The Dream That Started Everything

Two years ago this December, I had a dream that changed everything.

That dream became the seed of The Galatean Saga. Since then, I’ve written, rewritten, and built out the canon of this universe—its wars, its cadets, its fractured families, and its long shadow between Earth and Galatea. I’ve completed drafts for three novels, but I’ve learned something crucial: writing the books is only the beginning. The editing, polishing, cover design, formatting—everything that goes into releasing something of real value—takes even longer than writing the drafts themselves.

item.title: The Spacer
item.description:
A December Chronicles Novella

Genre: Science Fiction | Psychological Thriller
Series: The Galatean Saga: December Chronicles 0I
Publication Date: 4 December 2025
Length: Novella (~35,000 words)

Synopsis

  1. On Surinam Station, the story of Commander Gordon Monihan is more than history—it is a legend. For apprentices Bindy and Bentley, the tale is a debate about glory and heroism. But the silent, watchful apprentice, Bem, hears something else in their Sergeant’s voice. He sees the cracks in the official narrative and understands what the others do not: the truth is far deadlier than the myth.
